reviews.text: This hotel had the best service in Italy. I would recommend any person to use this hotel if they were to stay in Rome because of this service; and in addition, the rooms were very clean, and also comfortable. I enjoyed my stay there very much and would book the same place over in a heartbeat if ever in the area again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
We felt instantly at home
reviews.text: Monti is a "little village" in the middle of Rome, and there, in on of the charming, narrow streets, You find Hotel Grifo. On a trip to Rome five years ago we passed this lovely looking hotel and decided to stay there the next time, which we did in nov. 2008. On their website i´d read that the top floors had their own terrace and therefore i ordered one of them. Still, I hadnt actually been indside the hotel and therefore i coldnt be sure that the photos told the right story. They did. High expectations is a dangerous thing, but Grifo fulfilled our hopes for a romantic weekend. And more too.
We felt instantly at home. The service was excellent and the room was very nice. We will stay there the next time too, thats for sure.
reviews.title: Safe, quaint hotel in centre of town

reviews.text: The hotel's location is brilliant being a short walk from most of the city's most important monuments.. its in a quaint cobbled alleyway which give it the only sense of character it has.
reviews.title: Nice place in the hearth of Rome

likes.liked: — Stuff (mr. Alessandro), central location in a quiet street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly.. and when we forgot something in the room they kept it for us until our return to the hotel 4 days later which was very sweet of them.
reviews.title: Would stay there again

likes.disliked: — No lift in the apartment block

reviews.text: In February 2009 I stayed with a group of my students at Hotel Grifo. My compliments for the fine service and the most helpfull staf. They informed us about restaurants in the area, places of entertainment and other advantages.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotelrooms are comfortable and you can also get a good breakfast. The location of this hotel is also great. Not far from Termini Station and around the Colosseum and the Forum. In other words it is the perfect base from which you can start your trip through Rome.
reviews.title: Rome - a great city, friendly people and a quaint hotel!

reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Grifo at the end of Jan 2009. We had the most incredible stay. Rosa and the other reception staff where fantastic and gave us some excellent advice that made our adventures in Rome all that more memorable.
reviews.title: Excellent service, quiet and comfortable room

reviews.text: My party booked a 4 person room with terrace. Room was clean and terrace appealing. Particularly pleasing was the location in a central and attractive district, but quiet at night. So no problem with the late night Roman noise which one reads about.
reviews.title: Needs Some Renovation

reviews.text: Made very welcome by reception staff, with helpful advice re local restaurants etc. Able to leave bags pre/post checkout. Good value. Reception staff very happy to speak English in response to faltering Italian.
reviews.title: Great!

likes.disliked: — No room service, etc.. but we don't care!

reviews.text: i stayed with my friend from Hotel Grifo.i like it too much and city of the room and the people are really friendly.When we are making our reservation Mr Alessandro gave us to much information and it makes us very happy.i hope we will be there again as soon as possible.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Rome......

reviews.text: I take small tour groups to Italy in the summers and when we visit Rome we always stay at the Hotel Grifo. it is reasonably priced and the location is superb. It is close to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and many of the major sites in Rome. I love the neighborhood around the hotel. There are very good, reasonably priced restaurants and shops nearby. It is quiet, although it is close to several major streets making bus and metro access easy.
reviews.title: I always enjoy my stay at the Hotel Grifo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alessandro and his staff are excellent. They are very helpful and give lots of advice about good places to eat and shop. I have had to rearrange reservations for people in my group and Alessandro is always accommodating.
reviews.title: A great value hotel in a beautiful neighbourhood

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and the breakfast is good. I always request rooms with terraces in the hotel and enjoy sitting outside with a little wine and cheese. Many people in my tour groups have commented how much they enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Grifo.
reviews.title: Felt like Family

reviews.text: This hotel was excellent value for money. It's in the beautiful neighbourhood of Monti, which has a lovely village-like atmosphere. There were a number of high quality, low cost resturants near by. The rooms were small but well equiped and clean. Ours was a superior double and we had a lovely terrace with views on the fifth floor. The showers were fine, we didn't have a problem with them at all. Breakfast was OK, fresh fruit would be a welcome addition. The staff were all helpful and friendly. We're looking forward to staying here again some time soon!
reviews.title: Low Opinion of Hotel Grifo

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Hotel Grifo! It is a budget hotel at 112EU per room night! We booked 2 rooms, one for our 2 teenage sons, and one for us. When we arrived, they did not have the twin room ready for our sons, but separated the beds the next day so that worked out well.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Hotel Grifo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower in my sons' room was very small, so they had to come to our room to shower. Ours was bigger, not by much, but atleast you could turn around in it!
reviews.title: smallest room ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air conditioning was our biggest complaint! Being June, Rome was HOT!! It didn't even cool off at night, so opening the windows was not an option! We asked at the front desk, but were told that since the hotel was 400 years old, we would have to deal with it.
reviews.title: Lucky Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighborhood was very quaint, with many cafes, bars and restaurants, and a piazza with a fountain close by so you could relax and have a glass of wine or a gelato after a busy day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: The Grifo scored high on the priorities: clean, comfortable & convenient.

reviews.text: The Forum and Colosseum were within walking distance, which made it very convenient. The breakfast was standard continental fare, but included in the price and more than adequate for us. I would stay here again, but maybe not in summer!
reviews.title: The right choice for enjoying and exploring Rome
